Professor T. Tajima, a Member of IUPAP Commission 16 (Plasma Physics), promotes the liaison with the Ukrainian physicists. For example, Professor Vasyl Maslov, head of the Kharkov Institute of Physics and an academician of Ukrainian Academy of sciences, has been collaborating with him on laser wakefield acceleration in solid materials driven by X-rays. In July, 2019, Professor Tajima was invited to meet with János Áder, the President of Hungary. President Áder invited Dr. Tajima to the visit his office because the Hungarian government became aware of his research on energy and sustainability.
